articles.description: Equality before the law and equal protection of the laws within India.
Prohibition of discrimination on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex, or place of birth.
Equality of opportunity in matters of public employment.
Abolition of untouchability and prohibition of its practice.
Abolition of titles (except academic and military distinctions).
Six freedoms including speech, assembly, association, movement, residence, and profession.
Protection in respect of conviction for offenses (no double jeopardy, no ex post facto law).
Right to life and personal liberty.
Right to education (free and compulsory education for children aged 6â€“14 years).
Protection against arrest and detention in certain cases.
Prohibition of human trafficking and forced labor.
Prohibition of child labor in hazardous industries and occupations.
Freedom of conscience and the right to freely profess, practice, and propagate religion.
Freedom from payment of taxes for promotion of any religion.
Freedom from attending religious instruction in educational institutions wholly funded by the State.
Protection of the interests of minorities to preserve their culture, language, or script.
Right of minorities to establish and administer educational institutions.
Right to approach the Supreme Court or High Courts for enforcement of Fundamental Rights.
